HomePage.pls_select_a_file_to_edit: Please select a file to edit

file_header.SrcFileName_tip: Source file path; generally not used, but should not be empty. In most cases, the main game only uses this value in error logs (2.41.1). If your game is not the Japanese version, the game will attempt to use this value for translation matching.
file_header.ItemName_tip: Item name; not actually used, but should not be empty. The main game only reads and discards it (2.41.1), and it actually uses the value in the command section.
file_header.Category_tip: Item category; not actually used, but should not be empty. The main game only reads and discards it (2.41.1), and it actually uses the value in the command section.
file_header.SetInfoText_tip: Item description; generally not used, but should not be empty. The main game mostly reads and discards it (2.41.1). However, in certain scenarios if the value is "acctatoo" or "hokuro", the game will remove the accessories in those two slots.

commands.メニューフォルダ: This command is used to specify the path of the menu folder. If parameter 1 is 'man', it will be marked as a male menu; for clothing, keep it as 'DRESS' (2.41.1).
commands.category: Specifies the category this menu belongs to. The parameter must be one of the MPN enumeration values.
commands.属性追加: Seems to have no effect; no corresponding code found (2.41.1).
commands.catno: Seems to have no effect; no corresponding code found. For safety, set the parameter to 0. The main game checks that it isn't 0 but does nothing else (2.41.1).
commands.priority: Specifies the menu item's priority. Higher values are sorted later. It's a float. Do not go below 0, because 0 is used to remove the menu.
commands.name: Specifies the menu item's name.
commands.setumei: Specifies the menu item's description. Use `《改行》` for line breaks.
commands.icons: Specifies the menu item's icon. Enter the full file name (e.g., foo.tex). Alias: icon.
commands.icon: Specifies the menu item's icon. Enter the full file name (e.g., foo.tex). Alias: icons.
commands.iconl: Seems to have no effect; the main game checks that it isn't this value but does nothing else (2.41.1).
commands.onclickmenu: Seems to have no effect; no corresponding code found. Possibly just a visual divider (2.41.1).
commands.消去node設定開始: Seems to have no effect; no corresponding code found. Possibly just a visual divider (2.41.1).
commands.消去node設定終了: Seems to have no effect; no corresponding code found. Possibly just a visual divider (2.41.1).
commands.node消去: Used to hide a certain bone and its corresponding vertex group. Parameter 1 is a bone name keyword; any bone containing this keyword will be hidden. However, its category must be one of the values in m_strDefSlotName.
commands.setstr: Seems to have no effect; the main game checks that it isn't this value but does nothing else (2.41.1).
commands.color_set: Specifies the color for a certain category. Parameter 1 is an MPN enumeration, and parameter 2 is the color.
commands.tex: Specifies the material to be changed. Parameter 1 is an MPN enumeration, parameter 2 is the material index, parameter 3 is the material file name (e.g., foo.mate), parameter 4 is unknown, and parameter 5 is the unlimited-color category. Alias: テクスチャ変更.
commands.マテリアル変更: Specifies the material to be changed. Parameter 1 is an MPN enumeration, parameter 2 is the material index, parameter 3 is the material file name (e.g., foo.mate), parameter 4 is unknown, and parameter 5 is the unlimited-color category. Alias: tex.
commands.アイテムパラメータ: Used to set extra parameters (variable name, value) for an item in a slot, such as attributes or configuration. Parameter 1 is an MPN enumeration, parameter 2 is the variable name, and parameter 3 is the value.
commands.additem: Adds a model to the specified category. Parameters must be 2, 4, or 5. Parameter 1 is an MPN enumeration, parameter 2 is the model file (e.g., foo.model), parameter 3 is 'attach', parameter 4 is the attachment point's MPN enumeration, and parameter 5 is the attachment point name.
commands.delitem: Removes the model from the specified category. Parameter 1 is an MPN enumeration.
commands.collabo: No parameters. Marks this item as a collaboration item.

snippet.pre_filled_tip: Pre-filled; multi-line insertion with parameter placeholders
snippet.name: Item Name

MenuEditor.ctrl_space: In Tree Indentation format, press `Ctrl + Space` to show completion options.
MenuEditor.other_shortcuts: For other shortcut keys, please see the default shortcuts for Monaco Editor.
MenuEditor.format_tree_tsv_use_tab: For both Tree Indentation and TSV formats, use the `Tab` key for indentation, not spaces.
MenuEditor.only_tree_indent_have_autocomplete: Auto-completion and hints are only available in Tree Indentation format.

file_header.Name: Remark Name
file_header.Name_tip: Name is just for reference; the main game reads and discards it (2.41.1).
file_header.Material_Name_tip: The game sets this value to material.name and will try to find a .pmat file of the same name to use.
file_header.Material_ShaderName_tip: The game tries to find and use a shader with the same name.
file_header.Material_ShaderFilename_tip: The game tries to find the shader file under a specific path.

MateEditor.property_name_tip: Property Name; the game sets it as the corresponding name. For textures, it becomes the texture name; for colors, the texture's color, etc.
MateEditor.col_tip: Color (col). The game sets the color of the corresponding texture to this value.
MateEditor.vec_tip: Vector (vec). Essentially a color, but instead of RGBA it's XYZW. The game sets the color of the corresponding texture to this value.
MateEditor.tex2dName_tip: 2D texture name; the game tries to find and load a .tex file of the same name.
MateEditor.tex2dPath_tip: Not used, but should not be empty. The main game reads and discards it (2.41.1).
MateEditor.unknown_text_1_tip: Unknown text 1; the main game reads and discards it (2.41.1). Possibly a Render Texture reference.
MateEditor.unknown_text_2_tip: Unknown text 2; the main game reads and discards it (2.41.1). Possibly a Render Texture reference.

file_header.Hash_tip: Hash; the game needs to compute a hash for caching (2.41.1). Regardless of what you fill in, it will be overwritten by the computed value when saving. Unfortunately, different editors compute hashes differently, so even if values match, a file saved by another editor might not be identical, which can affect caching and take up a bit more memory.

PMatEditor.materialName_tip: Must match the material name in the .mate file exactly (2.41.1). The editor uses it for hash computation.
PMatEditor.renderQueue_tip: Render Queue (RQ); the main game uses this for rendering order (2.41.1). Higher values are rendered later. Generally, rendering happens layer by layer, so later layers stack on top of earlier ones. Default range is 0–5000.
PMatEditor.shaderName_tip: Shader name; the main game doesn't read this field (2.41.1). However, the editor uses it for hash computation to avoid issues if different shaders share a material name. Thus, you should fill it in correctly.

Errors.pls_input_menu_file_path_to_open: Please enter the .menu file path to open
Errors.pls_input_file_path_first: Please enter a file path first
Errors.json_root_node_not_array: JSON root node is not an array
Errors.invalid_path_or_mate_data: Invalid file path or Mate data
Errors.file_type_not_supported: This file type is currently not supported
